Title: EM - Elections - Assign Non-Election-Template Offices - Wireframe

Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing Election
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Search Election
Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed

Step Action: Choose an existing Election and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"
Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed

Step Action: Check to make sure the UI looks good on multiple screen sizes and different browsers
Step Expected: UI looks and works as expected

Title: EM - Elections - Assign Non-Election-Template Offices - Loading

Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have an existing Office (e.g. TEST OFFICE)
- Have an existing Election Template with that Office assigned (e.g. TEST TEMPLATE)
- Have an existing Election with that Election Template assigned (e.g. TEST ELECTION)
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Search Election
Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed

Step Action: Find the existing Election (e.g. TEST ELECTION) and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"
Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed

Step Action: Check "Election Date Name" field
Step Expected: Election Date Name should be prefilled and show the correct Election Name

Step Action: Check "Election Type" field
Step Expected: Election Type should be prefilled and show the correct Election Type

Step Action: Click on the "Office Type" dropdown
Step Expected: A different list of options will display depending on the type of user that is logged into the system (Right now there is only one user type and this will show COUNTY and MUNICIPAL)

Step Action: Select an Office Type
Step Expected: Office Type selected

Step Action: Check the "Office Details"
Step Expected: A list of Offices will be displayed

Step Action: Check the list of Offices
Step Expected: Only the Offices that are not assigned to the Template that the Election uses will be displayed (e.g. Since this is the TEST ELECTION and it uses the TEST TEMPLATE, the TEST OFFICE will not be shown in this list)

Step Action: Select any Office from the list and click on the arrow pointing to the right
Step Expected: The chosen Office will now be moved to the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list

Step Action: Click "Save"
Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and you are taken back to the Election Search page

Step Action: Find the Election you just assigned an Office to (e.g. TEST ELECTION) and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"
Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed

Step Action: Check the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list
Step Expected: The Office you just assigned will be displayed here

Title: EM - Elections - Assign Non-Election-Template Offices - Saving

Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have existing Offices
- Have an existing Election
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Search Election
Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed

Step Action: Choose an Election and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"
Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed

Step Action: Select an Office Type
Step Expected: Office Type selected

Step Action: Select any Office from the "Office Details" list and click on the arrow pointing to the right
Step Expected: The chosen Office will now be moved to the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list

Step Action: Click "Save"
Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and you are taken back to the Election Search page

Step Action: Find the Election you just assigned an Office to and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Assign Non-Election-Template Offices"
Step Expected: Assign Non-Election-Template Offices page is displayed

Step Action: Check the "Offices Assigned to the Election" list
Step Expected: The Office you just assigned will be displayed here

Title: 77533 - EM - Elections - Delete Election

Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
1. Have an existing Election that is not assigned to any Candidates
2. Have an existing Election that is assigned to a candidate
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Elections > Search Election
Step Expected: Election Search page is displayed

Step Action: Find the Election that is not assigned to any Candidates and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Delete"
Step Expected: A pop-up box will be displayed asking the user if they are sure they want to delete the Election

Step Action: Click "Cancel"
Step Expected: The pop-up box will be removed and nothing will happen

Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Delete"
Step Expected: A pop-up box will be displayed asking the user if they are sure they want to delete the Election

Step Action: Click "Ok"
Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and the Election will be removed from the system

Step Action: Find the existing Election that is assigned to a Candidate and click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Step Expected: Options displayed

Step Action: Click "Delete"
Step Expected: A pop-up box will be displayed asking the user if they are sure they want to delete the Election

Step Action: Click "Ok"
Step Expected: A notification saying "Election cannot be deleted" will display and the Election will still exist in the system

Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly

Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly

Step Action: Find the existing Election with the status of "Archived" and ensure all the right information is displayed in the columns
Step Expected: All information is displayed correctly

Step Expected: Options listed

Step Expected: All Election Status options work as expected and display the correct Elections when searched for

Title: 79660-EM - Election Template - Copy and Save Functionality

Step Action: Navigate to EM-Elections-Search Election Template
Step Expected: Search Election Template Page must be displayed

Step Action: Select a template and click on Actions-"Copy and Save"
Step Expected: Maintain Election Template Page must be displayed

Step Action: Edit the template name, office selections and click on "Save"
Step Expected: Election Template must be saved successfully

Step Action: Verify the added new template appears in the Search Election Template page
Step Expected: Added template must be displayed

Step Action:
Validate any updates made to the copied template are reflected in the 
 original Template
Step Expected: Original template must remain unchanged

Step Action: Verify if correct  error message is displayed when a user tries to save a template without updating its name.
Step Expected: "Election Template already exists " error must be displayed

Step Action: Edit offices and click on  "Cancel"
Step Expected: Updates to election template should not be saved  and the user must be  navigated to the "Election Template Search" Page

Title: 79634 - EM - Elections - Election Template Search - Implement partial search and wildcard

Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing Election Template
Access the EMS system
Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Step Action: Navigate to Election Management > Elections > Search Election Template
Step Expected: Election Template Search page is displayed

Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter the first few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by "%" (e.g. TH%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Election Templates beginning with those first few characters entered will displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter "%" followed by the last few characters of the existing Election Template name (e.g. TE%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Election Templates ending with those last few characters entered will displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by another "%" (e.g. %EC%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Election Templates with those few characters entered (in that order) will be displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter the first few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by "%" and then any few characters that the name contains, followed by another "%" (e.g. T%PL%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Election Templates that begin with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Election Template Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by another "%" and then the last few characters of the Election Name (e.g. %CT%E)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Election Templates that finish with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Election Template will also be shown

Hit "Save"

Title: EM - Elections - Election Calendar End-to-End Scenario

Step Action: EM - Elections - Election Calendar - Manage Election Dates
Navigate to EM -> Elections -> Election Calendar
Step Expected: Election Calendar page loads successfully with available events

Step Action: 1. Enter election date name from dropdown list.  2. Select an event from the dropdown list 3. Click ADD NEW choose a date from the date picker. Click on ADD EVENT and select event from the dropdown list and choose a date picker and click SAVE
Step Expected: New Election Calendar Event is successfully added and displayed in the list

Step Action: 1. Modify an existing event date2. Click 'Save'
Step Expected: Changes are saved, and the updated event persists in the system

Step Action: 1. Modify an event date2. Click 'Cancel'
Step Expected: Changes are discarded, and the previous values remain unchanged

Step Action: 1. Select an event from the list2. Click 'Delete'3. Confirm deletion
Step Expected: The event is removed from the list and the database

Step Action: 1. Access an existing election2. Navigate to Election Calendar3. Add, modify, or delete an event4. Click 'Save'
Step Expected: All updates are saved and persisted correctly

Step Action: 1. Log out and log back in2. Navigate to Election Calendar3. Verify if saved events and modifications are still available
Step Expected: All saved events and modifications persist in the system

Step Action: 1. Attempt to save an event without selecting a date2. Attempt to save duplicate events
Step Expected: System displays appropriate validation messages and prevents invalid actions

Step Action: Verify the UI components (Dropdown, Date Picker, Save, Delete, cancel buttons) are working as expected
Step Expected: All UI elements function correctly and align with usability standards

Step Action: 1. Navigate to Copy Election Calendar section2. Select Election Date Name and Election Type3. Choose a Previous Election Calendar4. Verify displayed event details (Event Code, Name, Event Date)5. Select the Election Calendar to Copy To6. Confirm copy operation
Step Expected: The selected Election Calendar events are successfully copied to the new Election Calendar

Step Action: 1. Navigate to Import File section2. Select Election Date Name3. Select Event4. Click 'Import File'
Step Expected: The selected file is successfully imported, and the event details are updated accordingly

Title: 69145-EM - Elections - Election Calendar - Save / Cancel Event changes

Step Action: PreCondition :User must have appropriate authorization to modify Election Calendar Event
Navigate to the EM - Elections - Election Calendar
Step Expected: The Election Calendar page is displayed with existing events.

Step Action: Click on Add event fill the requried fields
Step Expected: The changes are reflected on the UI but not yet saved.

Step Action: Click the "Save" button.
Step Expected: The modifications are successfully saved. A confirmation message appears.

Step Action: Refresh or reload the page.
Step Expected: The saved changes should still be present

Step Action: Modify an event
Step Expected: The changes appear in the UI but are not saved yet.

Step Action: Click the "Cancel" button.
Step Expected: The modifications are discarded, and the event reverts to the last saved state.

Step Action: Refresh or reload the page.
Step Expected: The event details should reflect the last successfully saved state.

Title: 71853 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Add 'Add Contest' nav element

Step Action: Preconditions:The user must be logged in with appropriate permissions to manage election contests.An election must be created and accessible in the system.The Manage Contests page must be available with an active contest.
Navigate to the Manage Election Contests page from the Election Search menu
Step Expected: The Manage Election Contests page should load successfully

Step Expected: The "Add Office" button should be visible

Step Expected: The system should navigate the user to the Manage Election Offices page

Step Action: Verify that the Manage Election Offices page loads correctly with available election offices
Step Expected: The page should display the list of available election offices

Step Action: Attempt to add a new office from the Manage Election Offices page
Step Expected: The system should allow the user to add an office successfully

Step Action: Navigate back to the Manage Election Contests page and confirm that the newly added office is available for selection
Step Expected: The newly added office should appear as an option in contest creation

Title: 73205 - EM - Manage Election Contests - Configure Election Contests - Contest Details Cancel

Step Action:
1. Navigate to Manage Election Contests from the Election Search menu. 
 2. Select a contest and open the Contest Details page
Step Expected: The Contest Details page should load successfully

Step Action:
1. Make changes to any editable fields on the Contest Details page. 
 2. Do NOT click Save
Step Expected: Changes should appear on the screen but remain unsaved

Step Action:
Click the Cancel button. 
 2. Confirm cancellation if a confirmation prompt appears
Step Expected: The system should discard all unsaved changes and return the user to the Configure Election Contests page

Step Action:
1. Navigate back to the same contest's Contest Details page. 
 2. Check if the changes made before clicking Cancel were discarded
Step Expected: All previously unsaved changes should be discarded, and only the last saved values should be displayed

Step Action: After clicking Cancel, verify that the user is redirected back to the Configure Election Contests page
Step Expected: The Configure Election Contests page should load correctly, displaying the list of contests

Title: EM - Election - Manage Election Precincts - Save/ Cancel

Step Action:
Navigate to the "Manage Election Precincts" page.
 2. In the "Search Elections" section, select an "Election Date Name".
 3. Choose the "Election Type"
Step Expected: The election is displayed in the search results, based on the selected "Election Date Name" and "Election Type"

Step Action:
1. Select "District Type" from the search filter options.
 2. Choose "All" or a specific district type (e.g., "SENATE DISTRICT 15")
Step Expected: The district list filters to show only the selected district type

Step Action:
1. Select a district (e.g., "SENATE DISTRICT 15").
 2. Click "Precincts in This District"
Step Expected: The available precincts are displayed, showing the precinct names and counts (e.g., "Precincts Available: 0")

Step Action: 1. From the district precinct list, select desired precincts (e.g., "BOONE 01", "DEN STREET-1/2", "DEN STREET-2/2")
Step Expected: The selected precincts are listed under "Included Election Precincts" with the selected count

Step Action: 1. After selecting precincts, verify the displayed count of selected precincts
Step Expected: The count of selected precincts is displayed correctly

Step Action:
1. After selecting the precincts, click "SAVE".
 2. Confirm that the action completes successfully and precincts are saved
Step Expected: The selected precincts are saved and no errors are encountered

Step Action:
1. After selecting the precincts, click "CANCEL".
 2. Confirm that the action cancels the selection and returns to the previous screen without saving changes
Step Expected: The selected precincts are not saved, and the system returns to the previous page without making changes

Step Action:
1. Navigate to the selected district
 2. Verify the selected precincts appear under the "Precincts in This District" section.
Step Expected: The selected precincts are displayed correctly under the district.
